text.0_Chapter, 0_Verse: Happy the man who has not walked in the council of the wicked, or stood in the paths of sinners, or taken a seat in the band of mockers.
text.0_Chapter, 1_Verse: Instead his pleasure is in the law of the Lord, and in his Torah he meditates day and night.
text.0_Chapter, 2_Verse: And he will be like a living tree planted by streams of water, whose fruit ripens in due course, and its leaves do not fall, and all its branches that grow ripen and flourish.
text.0_Chapter, 3_Verse: Not so the wicked; instead, they are like the chaff that the storm-wind will drive.
text.0_Chapter, 4_Verse: Therefore the wicked will not be acquitted in the great day, nor sinners in the band of the righteous,
text.0_Chapter, 5_Verse: Because the path of the righteous is manifest in the Lord’s presence, but the paths of the wicked will perish.
text.1_Chapter, 0_Verse: Why are the nations disturbed, and murmuring vanity?
text.1_Chapter, 1_Verse: The kings of the earth arise and the rulers will join together to rebel in the Lord’s presence, and to strive against His Anointed.
text.1_Chapter, 2_Verse: They say, “Let us break their bonds, and let us throw off their chains from us.”
text.1_Chapter, 3_Verse: The One Who sits in Heaven will laugh; the word of the Lord will mock at them.
text.1_Chapter, 4_Verse: Then He will speak to them in His strength, and in His wrath He will frighten them.
text.1_Chapter, 5_Verse: "And I have anointed My king, and appointed him over My Sanctuary."
text.1_Chapter, 6_Verse: I will tell of the covenant of the Lord. He said: “You are as dear to Me as a son to a father, pure as if this day I had created you.”
text.1_Chapter, 7_Verse: "Ask Me and I will give the spoils of nations as your inheritance, the rulers of the ends of the earth as your holding."
text.1_Chapter, 8_Verse: "You will shatter them as with a rod of iron, like a potter’s vessel you will break them."
text.1_Chapter, 9_Verse: And now, O kings, grow wise; accept discipline, O princes of the earth.
text.1_Chapter, 10_Verse: Worship in the presence of the Lord with fear, and pray with trembling.
text.1_Chapter, 11_Verse: Accept instruction lest He be angry, and you lose your way; for His wrath will tarry a little. Happy all who trust in His Word!
text.2_Chapter, 0_Verse: A psalm of David, when he fled from the presence of Absalom his son.
text.2_Chapter, 1_Verse: Lord, how many are my oppressors, many who arise against me!
text.2_Chapter, 2_Verse: Many say to my soul, “There is no redemption for him in God forever.”
text.2_Chapter, 3_Verse: But you, Lord, are a shield over me, my glory and the one who raises my head.
text.2_Chapter, 4_Verse: I pray, my voice in the presence of the Lord; He will accept my prayer from the Mount of His Holy Temple forever.
text.2_Chapter, 5_Verse: I lay down, and I slept; I awoke, because the Lord sustains me.
text.2_Chapter, 6_Verse: I will not be afraid of the myriads of people who have gathered against me all around.
text.2_Chapter, 7_Verse: Arise, O Lord, redeem me, O my God; for you have struck all my enemies on their cheek, you have broken the teeth of the wicked.
text.2_Chapter, 8_Verse: Redemption is from the presence of the Lord; your blessings are to your people forever.
text.3_Chapter, 0_Verse: For praise, with melodies: A hymn of David
text.3_Chapter, 1_Verse: At the time of my prayer, accept it from me, O God of my righteousness; at the time of distress, you relieved me; pity me and accept my prayer.
text.3_Chapter, 2_Verse: Sons of men, why is my glory for humiliation? You will love vanity; you will seek falsehood forever.
text.3_Chapter, 3_Verse: And they will know, for the Lord has separated the righteous man for Himself; the Lord will accept the prayer of David when he calls to Him.
text.3_Chapter, 4_Verse: Tremble for Him, and do not sin; utter your petition with your mouth and your request in your heart; and pray upon your beds and remember the days of death forever.
text.3_Chapter, 5_Verse: Subdue your impulses and it will be reckoned to you as a righteous sacrifice; and hope in the Lord.
text.3_Chapter, 6_Verse: Many say, “Who will show us good?” Lift on us the light of your countenance, O Lord
text.3_Chapter, 7_Verse: You have placed joy in my heart when their grain and their wine has increased.
text.3_Chapter, 8_Verse: In peace I both lay down and sleep, because you alone are the Lord; in security you will make me dwell.
text.117_Chapter, 21_Verse: The boy the builders rejected; he was among the sons of Jesse and he was privileged to be appointed as king and ruler.
text.117_Chapter, 22_Verse: "This is from YHWH," said the builders; "It is marvelous before us," said the sons of Jesse.
text.117_Chapter, 23_Verse: "This is the day YHWH made [or acted]," said the builders; "Let us rejoice and be glad in it," said the sons of Jesse.
text.117_Chapter, 24_Verse: "Please, from you, O YHWH, now!" said the builders; "Please, from you, O YHWH, cause [us] to prosper, now!" said Jesse and his wife.
text.117_Chapter, 25_Verse: "Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the word of YHWH," said [the] builders; "They bless you from the house of the sanctuary of YHWH," said David.
text.117_Chapter, 26_Verse: "YHWH is God; he caused [light] to shine for us," said the tribes of the house of Judah; "Bind the lamb for the sacrifice of the feast with ropes until you offer him and you sprinkle his blood on the horns of the altar," said Samuel the prophet.
